item.description:
Film Night - Guantanamera

FREE

7:00 pm 

by the Cuban director of Strawberry & Chocolate - Tomás Gutiérrez Alea

We have been to this gallery for films before, they always tie in nicely with the current exhibit. Does Hank Paper's name sound familiar to you?  Maybe that's because you know him from New England's last standing video rental stores, BEST VIDEO in Hamden, CT.  Hank is a street photographer, shop owner and film extraordinaire.  Join us for a "Hank's Pick" screening of  Guantanamera  (by the Cuban director of Strawberry & Chocolate) during the run of "Cuba: Arrested Splendor."  Following the movie, Hank will lead a group discussion about the film.  The floor will be open to questions from the audience.  BYOP.  About the film: 

 

It is a satire about life in Cuba. The members of a funeral procession and some truckdrivers who have to take the same route begin to talk about god and the world ending up in discovering that life for both groups has many similarities as well as a lot of differences depending on the point of view. Written by Volker Boehm

When Aunt Yoyita dies during a visit to Gina in Guantánamo, Gina, along with Yoyita's childhood sweetheart, the aging Cándido, must take the body to Havana. To their annoyance, Gina's overbearing husband Adolfo, a punctilious undertaker with political ambitions, takes charge of the journey. On the road, they keep crossing paths with Mariano, a trucker who's a playboy with a woman at every way station. He and Gina recognize each other: he was her student and wrote her of how much he loved her, then dropped out of school in embarrassment. Before they reach Havana, Gina realizes she can choose between Adolfo and Mariano: does Aunt Yoyita's life help Gina decide?

The exhibit:

Hank Paper, "Cuba: Arrested Splendor"

Jason Friedes, "Domi-Cells"
About: This exhibition will explore the philosophical fences, lines and cages that we build between and around ourselves as nations, societies and individuals.  For his gallery debut, Friedes will present massive steel cages that viewers may open and enter and lock.Paper will present street photographs from Cuba that will review the impact of the most enduring trade embargo in modern history.
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the front of the gallery
item.name: Film Night - Guantanamera
